content.transcript:
The use of accurate tip-sensitive thermometers is the best way to check the temperature of hot or cold food. They should be validated or calibrated regularly, for example monthly, to ensure they remain accurate.

Melting ice in water and boiling water are usually used, although test caps are a suitable alternative.

The temperature for validation in ice is minus 1 degree Celsius to plus 1 degree Celsius, and the temperature for validation in boiling water is 99 degrees Celsius to 101 degrees Celsius.
